result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent M Gleason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
No controlled substances. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Firearm warning given. Comply with treatment and recovery program. Take all medications as prescribed. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.

**CORRECTED 2/12/2019: To reflect credit for time served as 241 days.**

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant is to inform physician that he is a narcotic addict and is not to be prescribed narcotics.  Any medications ordered defendant is to notify DOC Agent.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

10:03 AM Defendant Vincent M Gleason in court with attorney Elizabeth Martha Kulinski.  Defendant Vincent M Gleason in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams for Antoinette Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter returned for counsel to gather documentation regarding defendant's brain injury.
Defense has provided documentation to the State.  Defendant is competent, however, due to his traumatic brain injury he is cared for by a guardian for his lifetime.
Court reviews documentation provided by defense.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing after revocation.

BTC: Ct. 1:  3 yrs., 1 yr. IC, 2 yrs. ES, 217 days CFTS.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
